summary: This is an email chain from May 2019 discussing the briefing of the Deputy Attorney General (DAG) on cases from the Southern District of New York, including the Epstein case. It indicates that memos were prepared and conveyed, and that the briefing went well with no concerns expressed.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient of the email chain and author of one of the memos for the DAG briefing. The subject line and content reference him.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, prepared a memo for the Deputy Attorney General (Ed) as part of a case briefing.

events.title: Memos Prepared for DAG Briefing
events.description: Two memos were prepared and sent for a briefing with the Deputy Attorney General (DAG), one from Geoffrey Berman and another on recusal matters. The Epstein case was added to the briefing materials.

events.title: DAG Briefing on Cases
events.description: A briefing for the Deputy Attorney General (DAG) on cases, including the Epstein case, took place. The briefing was reported to have gone well with no concerns expressed.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from May 23-24, 2019, regarding the briefing of the Deputy Attorney General (DAG) on SDNY cases.
Two memos were prepared for the briefing: one from Geoffrey Berman and another on recusal matters.
The Epstein case was specifically added to the briefing materials for the DAG.
The briefing with the DAG (referred to as 'Ed') was reported to have gone well with no concerns expressed.
